definition: to live/to dwell/to stay/to reside/to stop/(suffix indicating firmness, steadiness, or coming to a halt)

sentences.english: If I knew his address, I could write him.
sentences.chinese: 辱果我知道他的住址，斡会写信给他。

sentences.english: Man: Slow down and tell me your address.
sentences.chinese: 慢慢说，告诉我你的住址。

sentences.english: It is made of black leather， with my name and address on it.
sentences.chinese: 它是黑色皮革制品，而且上面还有我的姓名和住址。

sentences.english: I finally managed to prise his new address out of her.
sentences.chinese: 我最终从她口中套出了他的新住址。

sentences.english: A reigning Hindu princess or queen.
sentences.chinese: 我的住址是公主路二十一号。

sentences.english: Don't forget to tag your suitcases with your name and address.
sentences.chinese: 别忘了在你的衣箱上贴上写有你的姓名和住址的标签。

sentences.english: The only thing legible on the torn envelope was the return address.
sentences.chinese: 唯一能看清的是那个破损信封上的寄信人的住址。

sentences.english: The westerner thought that leaves behind the address to the human, must ask opposite party to sojourn proficiently .
sentences.chinese: 西方人认为给人留下住址，就得请对方到家作客。

sentences.english: If you want to get the presents given during our discountable period, please fill in your address.
sentences.chinese: 如想得到我们优惠活动期间的礼品，请填写您的住址。

sentences.english: He did not know their address.
Please address the letter for me.
sentences.chinese: 请在信里给我写上住址。

sentences.english: Be sure to use the recipients correct legal name and address.
sentences.chinese: 写清收信人的法定名称和住址。

sentences.english: For example: credit card numbers, passport details, home address.
sentences.chinese: 比如，银行卡号，护照信息，家庭住址等等。

definition: one's native place/place of ancestry/registered birthplace
